Sligo]] |death_date = |death_place = |nationality =[[Irish people|Irish]] |residence = [[Rathmichael]], Dublin, Ireland |occupation = Retired CEO of [[Irish Nationwide Building Society]]. |salary = €'''2.4 [[1000000 (number)|million]]''' (2008) |networth = €'''27.6 [[1000000 (number)|million]]''' (2007) |spouse = Eileen |website = |children = Michael Fingleton Jnr. }} '''Michael Fingleton''' is a former chief executive of [[Irish Nationwide Building Society]]. He joined the building society in 1971 and retired in April 2009 as the effects of the [[2008–2012 Irish banking crisis]] became apparent. He is known as "Fingers" in the banking community.<ref name ="Fingers">{{cite web|url=http://www.irishtimes.com/newspaper/finance/2009/0501/1224245756853.html|author=Simon Carswell|title=What lies in store for Irish Nationwide after Fingleton?|publisher=''[[Irish Times]]''|date=01/05/2010|accessdate=5 May 2010}}</ref>
==Early life and career== Michael Fingleton was born in [[Tubbercurry]], [[Co. Sligo]] in 1938, the son of a local [[Garda Síochána|Garda]]. He attended St Nathy's school in [[Ballaghaderreen]], and in later years [[University College Dublin|UCD]], [[Trinity College, Dublin|TCD]] and [[Kings Inns]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.independent.ie/business/michael-fingleton-the-cv-477533.html|title=MICHAEL FINGLETON THE CV|publisher= ''[[Irish Independent]]''|date=22 February 2004|accessdate=30 April 2010}}</ref> He attended a [[seminary]], but quit before taking his vows.<ref name="Pointing Fingers">{{cite web|url=http://archives.tcm.ie/businesspost/2009/02/22/story39728.asp |title=Pointing Fingers |author=Nicola Cooke |publisher=''[[Sunday Business Post]]'' |date=22 February 2009 |accessdate=30 April 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090410043553/http://archives.tcm.ie/businesspost/2009/02/22/story39728.asp |archivedate=10 April 2009 |df= }}</ref>
In the early Sixties, he joined [[Allied Irish Finance]] and simultaneously began studying commerce. On earning his [[Academic degree|degree]], he went to the [[Dairy Disposal Agency]], a state body that took over defunct creameries in the west of Ireland. During this period, he studied at night to become a [[chartered accountant]].<ref name="Pointing Fingers"/>
Following this, he joined aid agency [[Concern Worldwide|Concern]] and from 1969 he spent a number of years organising food supplies to the [[Republic of Biafra]], the short-lived secessionist state in southeastern [[Nigeria]]. He eventually became chairman of Concern.<ref name="Pointing Fingers" />
==Career at Irish Nationwide== In 1971, he became the secretary of the Irish Independent Building Society, founded in 1873. At the time he was not a homeowner. The building society had five employees and assets of €2 million. In his first year at the helm, the company made a profit of just €12,000 and Fingleton had to wait three years for his first company car.<ref name ="one man" />
In 1973 he was [[called to the bar]], the same year that [[Dick Spring]], [[Michael McDowell (politician)|Michael McDowell]] and [[Adrian Hardiman]] were also called, although he never practised as a barrister.<ref name= "profile">{{cite web|url=http://www.independent.ie/opinion/analysis/profile--behind-the-kindly-smile-there-lurks-a-very-shrewd-operator-93213.html|title=PROFILE : Behind the kindly smile there lurks a very shrewd operator|publisher=''[[Irish Independent]]''|date=17 June 2006|accessdate=5 May 2010}}</ref>
The building society changed its name to Irish Nationwide in 1975<ref name ="Finfacts">{{cite web|url=http://www.finfacts.ie/irishfinancenews/article_1019486.shtml|title=State bailed-out commercial property lender Irish Nationwide reports massive 2009 loss of €2.5bn|publisher=Finfacts Ireland|date=19 April 2010|accessdate=30 April 2010}}</ref> and began to expand. The key to its expansion was marketing, using the media to build the profile of the business. The emphasis was on the use of [[Agency (law)|agents]] rather than opening branches. Fingleton built it up into a network of 50 branches and 40 branch agents, helped by the takeover of the [[Garda Building Society]], Irish Mutual and Metropolitan Building Society and enacted a flexible [[mortgage loan|mortgage]] policy in the 1980s. Fingleton cultivated relationships with the press and benefitted by receiving free [[public relations|publicity]]. Many journalists in the 1980s received mortgages from the Irish Nationwide.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.finfacts.ie/irishfinancenews/article_1016362.shtml|title=Fingleton to resign from Irish Nationwide Building Society|publisher=Finfacts Ireland|date=02/04/2009|accessdate=5 May 2010}}</ref> Fingleton always stressed that these were all above board. During the 1980s, when he was at the height of his media profile, he sent journalists a Christmas card portraying himself as [[Santa Claus]].<ref name="The Post">{{cite web|url=http://archives.tcm.ie/businesspost/2005/05/01/story4378.asp |title=One-man building society |author=Ian Kehoe |publisher=''[[Sunday Business Post]]'' |date=01/05/2005 |accessdate=5 May 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20050521010645/http://archives.tcm.ie/businesspost/2005/05/01/story4378.asp |archivedate=21 May 2005 |df= }}</ref>
Fingleton drew a salary of €1.3m in 2005, including a €500,000 bonus making his earnings on a par with chief executives of the larger banks.<ref name= "profile" /> He began to look for [[demutualisation]] legislation in 2001 with the change in the law coming through in August 2006. In 2007, after failed talks with Germany's [[HypoVereinsbank]] and [[GE Money]], he almost sold the building society to Iceland's [[Landsbanki]]. Fingleton set Irish Nationwide's asset value close to €1.3 billion to reflect the equity he expected to be released from any deals. Fingleton expected to earn up to €15 million from the deal.<ref name ="one man">{{cite web|url=http://www.independent.ie/national-news/a-oneman-band-1366187.html|title=a one-man band?|publisher=''[[Irish Independent]]''|date=03/05/2008|accessdate=5 May 2010}}</ref> Landsbanki who were initially attracted by Irish Nationwide's deposit book, backed off, unnerved by the level of the society's commercial lending. The Icelandic bank collapsed nine months later.<ref name="Sunday Times" />
Fingleton had a reputation as an [[Autocracy|autocrat]]<ref name= "profile" /> and effectively ran a one-man lending department with loans of over €500,000 being personally approved by him.<ref name= "The Post" /> In 2002 it emerged that he had an affair with a subordinate who was provided with a £200,000 settlement after she took her case to the Employment Appeals Tribunal.<ref name = "Sticky Fingers" /> When Irish Nationwides home loans manager Brian Fitzgibbon sued to stop the building society from sacking him in 2007, it reinforced the impression that Fingleton totally dominated the institution. In his evidence, Fitzgibbon alleged that Fingleton over-ruled his decision not to lend money to rogue solicitors Micheal Lynn and Thomas Byrne to whom the building society loaned over €10m each. Fitzgibbon went on to allege that the Nationwide's lending decisions ''"were entirely informal and controlled by Michael Fingleton"''. Fitzgibbon also stated that many loans issued by the Irish Nationwide had not been approved by its credit committee, which existed only to satisfy the requirements of the [[Central Bank of Ireland]]. Fingleton said the society took "adequate provisions" in 2007 for loans to the rogue solicitors as it booked a total loan loss charge of €48.8m.<ref name="Pointing Fingers" /><ref name ="one man" />
By the end of 2007, Irish Nationwide had become a major financial institution with pre-tax profits of €390m for 2006 and gross assets of €16.1bn. He had managed to bring the group's cost-to-income ratio down to 10pc from 14.4pc the previous year.<ref name ="one man" /> The same year, Fingleton transferred a €27.6m pension fund from the society.<ref name="Sunday Times">{{cite web|url=http://business.timesonline.co.uk/tol/business/industry_sectors/banking_and_finance/article7094131.ece|title=Avoiding the fall out at Irish Nationwide|author=Aine Coffey|publisher=''[[The Sunday Times]]''|date=11/04/2010|accessdate=5 May 2010}}</ref>
===Loans to politicians and other public figures=== As well as arranging loans for journalists, Fingleton arranged loans for other political and public figures. In December 2009, after interviewing Olivia Greene, a former home loans supervisor at Irish Nationwide, Prime Time reported that former Minister for Finance [[Charlie McCreevy]] was loaned €1.6m for a €1.5m property by Irish Nationwide, when the building society wasn't supposed to be providing 100 per cent loans. He also provided a loan for [[Celia Larkin]], the ex-partner of former [[taoiseach]] [[Bertie Ahern]], without requiring any proof of income. John Mara, the son of former [[Fianna Fáil]] director of elections [[PJ Mara]], was also named in court as having drawn down big loans, including a €1.5 million loan for which Fingleton did not seek any additional security.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.thepost.ie/story/eyidqlgbql/ |title=The untouchable and the untenable |author=Kathleen Barrington |publisher=''[[Sunday Business Post]]'' |date=25 April 2010 |accessdate=5 May 2010 }}{{dead link|date=June 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref>
Greene also said current Fianna Fáil Senator [[Francis O'Brien]] and former FF Senator [[Don Lydon]] were given fast-track loans of €7m and €3m<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.irishexaminer.com/home/society-launches-loans-to-politicians-inquiry-108460.html#ixzz0n5qxbTUa|title=Society launches loans to politicians inquiry|author=Conor Ryan|publisher=''[[Irish Examiner]]''|date=23 December 2009|accessdate=5 May 2010}}</ref>
===Effects of the economic crisis and retirement=== The performance of the building society [[Post-2008 Irish economic downturn|crashed in 2008]] as bad loans spiralled. Irish Nationwide made a pretax loss of €280 million for the year, after writing off €464 million on bad loans, a 10-fold increase on the 2007 figure.<ref name ="Fingers" /> The state was eventually forced to inject €2.7 billion into the society to shore up its balance sheet and prevent the collapse of a [[Credit Institutions (Financial Support) Act 2008|government-guaranteed]] institution.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.sbpost.ie/newsfeatures/the-fall-of-the-house-of-fingleton-48820.html|title=The fall of the house of Fingleton|author=David Clerkin|publisher=''[[Sunday Business Post]]''|date=25 April 2010|accessdate=5 May 2010}}</ref>
In the run-up to the 2008 annual board meeting, with Fingleton approaching 70, when he would be required to retire as a director, the board considered tabling a motion that would permit him to stay on for another two years. The idea was abandoned and Fingleton refused to stay on as the chief executive unless he was paid the same amount as in 2007, when he had received a €1m bonus. At the end of April 2009, Fingleton retired, buffeted by criticism for receiving the €1m "bonus" in 2008.<ref name="Sunday Times" /> He left Irish Nationwide relying on the continued support of the Irish government through the guarantee scheme to raise funding from bond investors to keep the institution in business. Losses from 2009 of €2.5bn<ref name ="Finfacts" /> effectively wiped out all profits made by the society since its inception as Irish Nationwide.<ref name="Sticky Fingers">{{cite web|url=http://www.tribune.ie/news/article/2010/apr/25/sticky-fingers/ |title=Sticky Fingers |author=Michael Clifford |publisher=''The Tribune'' |date=25 April 2010 |accessdate=02/05/2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100430072018/http://www.tribune.ie/news/article/2010/apr/25/sticky-fingers/ |archivedate=30 April 2010 |df= }}</ref> Fingleton received €221k in pay for the final four months of his employment, up to April 2009. This amount, calculated on an annual basis, exceeded the cap of €500k imposed by the Government for top bankers.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.emigrant.ie/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=77600|title=Banks and bankers under scrutiny|publisher=''The Irish Emigrant''|date=26/04/10|accessdate=5 May 2010}}</ref>
As the depth of the society's problems became apparent, Fingleton came under public and political pressure to return the €1m bonus. In April 2010 he offered to give it to charity,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.sbpost.ie/breakingnews/ireland/eyojojcwgboj/|title=Fingleton wants to give €1m bonus to charity|publisher=''[[Sunday Business Post]]''|date=25 April 2009|accessdate=5 May 2010}}</ref> but this proposal was rejected by the Irish government.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.irishexaminer.com/business/fingletons-euro1m-to-charity-proposal-rejected-118135.html/|title=Fingleton's €1m to charity proposal rejected|publisher=''[[Irish Examiner]]''|date=26 April 2009|accessdate=23 December 2010}}</ref> As of December 2010 there was no evidence that the money had been returned.
==Personal and family== Michael Fingleton is married to his wife, Eileen. They live in Shankill in South Dublin.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.tribune.ie/article/2009/mar/29/fingleton-registered-irish-nationwide-loan-at-age-/ |title=Fingleton registered Irish Nationwide loan at age 68 |publisher=''[[Sunday Tribune]]'' |author=Neil Callanan and Emmet Oliver |date=29 March 2010 |accessdate=30 April 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090403014323/http://www.tribune.ie/article/2009/mar/29/fingleton-registered-irish-nationwide-loan-at-age-/ |archivedate=3 April 2009 |df= }}</ref> He enjoys [[horse racing]] and frequently attends racing festivals. They have four children. Their son, Michael Fingleton jnr, is a former employee of Irish Nationwide.<ref name="Pointing Fingers" />
==See also== * [[Seán FitzPatrick]] * [[Irish property bubble]] * [[Post-2008 Irish economic downturn]]
==References== {{reflist}}
==Further reading== * ''Fingers: The Man Who Brought Down Irish Nationwide and Cost Us €5.4bn'' ({{ISBN|978-0717155835}}), by Tom Lyons and Richard Curran, 2013
==External links== * {{YouTube|RqGaKVSo-Jg|Michael Fingleton, Irish Nationwide and George Lee, RTE discuss Mortgage Regulations}} * [http://www.irishnationwide.ie/reports/inbs/46327%20Irish%20Nationwide%20AR%2008.pdf Irish Nationwide Annual Report & Accounts 2008]{{dead link|date=June 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}

[[Order of Ontario]] }} '''Michael Christian de Pencier''', {{Post-nominals|country=CAN|CM|OOnt}} (born January 19, 1935){{cite book|title=Canadian Who's Who, 1992|author=Kieran Simpson}} is an entrepreneur, environmental investor, and publisher.http://www.gg.ca/honour.aspx?id=6441&t=12 He is the grandson of Archbishop [[Adam de Pencier]] and brother-in-law of [[Richard A. N. Bonnycastle]]. Born in [[Toronto]], [[Ontario]], de Pencier attended [[Trinity College School]], the [[University of Toronto]] where he was a member of the Toronto Chapter of [[Alpha Delta Phi]],{{cite book|title=Torontonensis|date=1957|publisher=University of Toronto Students' Administrative Council|location=Toronto, ON|page=284}} and the [[University of Michigan]]. He is the chairman of Key Publishers Company Limited. In this role, he launched, acquired or ran many of the country’s leading magazines, including ''[[Toronto Life]]'', ''[[Canadian Geographic]]'', ''[[Quill and Quire]]'', Where Magazines and ''[[Canadian Business]]''. An active environmental investor, de Pencier is the co-founder of Investeco Capital Corporation and the Green Living Show.http://www.greenlivingonline.com/torontoshow/index.html{{cite web |url=http://www.investeco.com/about-us-management-team-1.php |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2010-09-25 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100915134707/http://www.investeco.com/about-us-management-team-1.php |archivedate=2010-09-15 |df= }} He is also the past Chairman of [[WWF-Canada]] and the [[Ontario College of Art]]. In 2013, he was honored as the 2013 leader for conservation.{{cite web|title=2013 Leader For Conservation|url=http://www.wwf.ca/events/panda_ball/wwf_environmental_awards/|publisher=WWF Canada|accessdate=20 May 2014|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140521033319/http://www.wwf.ca/events/panda_ball/wwf_environmental_awards/|archivedate=21 May 2014|df=}} As one of Canada's leading magazine publishers, de Pencier was awarded the [[Order of Ontario]] in 1997, the [[Order of Canada]] in 1999, and an honorary Doctor of Letters in 2002 from [[Ryerson University]].http://www.gg.ca/honour.aspx?id=6441&t=12http://www.citizenship.gov.on.ca/english/citizenship/honours/orderofontario_appointees.shtml#1997http://www.trentu.ca/news/pressreleases/depencier.html He is the father of film producers [[Nicholas de Pencier]] and [[Miranda de Pencier]].[https://torontolife.com/city/life/michael-de-pencier-toronto-life/ "The Accidental Mogul"]. ''[[Toronto Life]]'', November 3, 2016. ==References== {{Reflist|30em}} {{DEFAULTSORT:de Pencier, Michael}} [[Category:1935 births]] [[Category:Businesspeople from Toronto]] [[Category:Canadian businesspeople]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Members of the Order of Canada]] [[Category:Members of the Order of Ontario]] [[Category:University of Michigan alumni]]

{{refimprove|date=February 2017}} {{Infobox company <!-- Commented out: | logo = File:Microsoft Dynamics Logo.png -->| logo_size = 200px | homepage = {{url|http://www.microsoft.com/erp}} }} '''Microsoft Dynamics ERP''' is [[enterprise resource planning]] (ERP) software primarily geared toward midsize organizations as well as subsidiaries and divisions of larger organizations. Its applications are part of [[Microsoft Dynamics]], a line of business management software owned and developed by [[Microsoft]].
Microsoft Dynamics ERP comprises five primary products: [[Axapta|Microsoft Dynamics AX]], [[Great Plains Software|Microsoft Dynamics GP]], [[Navision|Microsoft Dynamics NAV]], [[Solomon IV|Microsoft Dynamics SL]] and [[Microsoft Dynamics C5]].
==Products== Microsoft Dynamics ERP includes five primary products: *[[Microsoft Dynamics AX]] (formerly Axapta) is designed to help organizations do business across locations and countries by standardizing processes and helping to simplify compliance. The latest version is Microsoft Dynamics AX 2012 R3 CU8.<ref name=":0">{{Cite web|url=http://www.queueassoc.com/solution/what-is-erp-crm/|title=What is Microsoft Dynamics ERP & CRM?|website=Queue}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.microsoft.com/en-in/dynamics/erp-ax-overview.aspx|title=Microsoft's ERP solution|website=Microsoft}}</ref> *[[Microsoft Dynamics GP]]<ref name=":0" /> (formerly Great Plains Software) can help companies adapt to new opportunities and growth by managing changing markets, enabling unique business requirements, and connecting business processes across the organization. The latest version is Microsoft Dynamics GP 2018. *[[Microsoft Dynamics NAV]] (formerly Navision) is designed to help organizations streamline specialized and industry-specific business processes. The latest version is Microsoft Dynamics NAV 2018.<ref name=":1">{{Cite web|url=http://www.erpsoftwareblog.com/category/about-microsoft-dynamics-nav/}}</ref> *[[Microsoft Dynamics SL]] (formerly Solomon IV) can help project-driven organizations obtain reports and business analysis and automate projects across company divisions and locations. The latest version is Microsoft Dynamics SL 2015.<ref name=":1" /> *[[Microsoft Dynamics C5]] (formerly Concorde C5) can assist with finance, manufacturing, supply chains, analytics and electronic commerce for small and medium-sized enterprises. The latest version is Microsoft Dynamics C5 2012.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://global.eg.dk/competencies/erp-systems/microsoft-dynamics-c5|title=Microsoft Dynamics C5|website=EG}}</ref>
==Capabilities== Microsoft Dynamics ERP applications are designed to help customers: * Manage the entire supply chain. * Make current financial data and reports accessible for business planning and regulatory compliance. * Automate repetitious and routine functions so that employees can focus on more critical tasks. * Minimize the cost and complexity of administering salaries, benefits, recruiting, and performance management. * Provide greater visibility into key performance factors, such as profitability and potential issues. * Meet industry-specific needs with functionality for vertical business processes.
Microsoft Dynamics ERP has five focus industries: *[[Financial services|Financial Services]] *[[Manufacturing]] *[[Public sector|Public Sector]] *[[Retail]] *[[Tertiary sector of the economy|Service Industry]]

{{Infobox person |name=Murat Köprülü |image= Murat Koprulu ATS Chairman.JPG |birth_name = Murat Nafiz Köprülü |birth_place = Ankara, Turkey |nationality=[[United States|American]], [[Turkey|Turkish]] |residence = [[New York, New York|New York City]] |alma_mater=[[Columbia University]], M.Phil
[[London School of Economics]], M.Sc.
[[University of Maryland]], B.S. |occupation = Managing Partner, ME Markets LLC, Chairman of The American Immigrant Society |http://www.americanimmigrantsociety.org| |website = {{URL|http://www.AmericanImmigrantSociety.org/|AmericanImmigrantSociety.org}} }} '''Murat Köprülü''' is a [[Turkish American]] investment professional and [[philanthropist]]. He is currently advisor on Emerging Markets to four hedge fund groups based in New York. He is also the Chairman of the [[American Turkish Society]], founded in 1949, the oldest U.S.-based [[Non-profit organization|not-for-profit organization]] that seeks to enhance economic, diplomatic, cultural, and educational ties between the United States and Turkey. ==Business career== Murat Köprülü's long tenure in investing in emerging markets since 1987 establishes him as a global expert in emerging markets; he has survived the emerging markets upheavals of [[1991 recession]], the 1994 [[Mexican peso crisis]], the 1997 East Asia Crisis, the [[1998 Russian financial crisis]], the [[early 2000s recession]], and the [[Global financial crisis of 2008]]. Köprülü began his career at the [[World Bank]], where he started at the age of 19 as a part-time consultant in computer modeling for the Research Department, while he was going to college. He then worked from 1980 through 1983 at the Turkey Desk and the Egypt Desk. From 1983 to 1986, Köprülü was Managing Director of IntraLink, Ltd., an international trade finance advisory firm, which provided financing sources for international trade transactions in a diverse list of emerging countries such as Egypt, Ivory Coast, Greece, Turkey, and the Philippines. Köprülü was formerly CEO of Multilateral Funding International (MFI), a [[New York City|New York]] based emerging markets investment and financial advisory firm, which he founded in 1988, specializing in the regions comprising Eastern Europe, Russia, Turkey, Middle East, and Central Asia. He was also the Managing Partner of MFI's brokerage affiliate, MFI Securities, L.P., trading in the capital markets of the same regions. In 2004, MFI established the Turkey Opportunity Fund to invest in Turkish equities. Köprülü is currently advisor on Emerging Markets to four hedge fund groups based in New York. Köprülü is also one of the earliest members of the [[Bretton Woods Committee]].[http://brettonwoods.org/page/september-2015-e-bulletin] He was presented with an Award of Excellence in 2004 from the International Center in New York. He wrote a seminal piece in the Bretton Woods Newsletter in September 2015 outlining his thesis that the emerging, growing global debt crisis of 2015-2016 would change the economies of the major world countries in significant ways. [[File:Mr. Murat Koprulu Delivering National Committee on American Foreign Policy Lecture.JPG|thumb|Murat Köprülü delivers "Turkey at a Historic Crossroads" lecture as part of the George D. Schwab Foreign Policy Briefings series hosted by The National Committee on American Foreign Policy on April 2, 2014.]] ==Philanthropy== Köprülü's charitable work has mainly focused on strengthening educational and cultural ties between the U.S. and Turkey. He is the Chairman of [http://www.americanturkishsociety.org/ The American Turkish Society]. He is the Chairman of The American Turkish Society. He assumed this position in June 2007 after the passing of [[Ahmet Ertegun]], the previous chairman of The Society, a prominent Turkish-American businessman and musician, and the founder of [[Atlantic Records]], in 2006.[http://worldmusiccentral.org/2006/12/16/music-legend-philanthropist-and-prominent-liaison-between-the-u-s-and-turkey-dies-at-83/Music Legend, Philanthropist and Prominent Liaison Between the U.S. and Turkey Dies at 83] WorldMusicCentral.org. (2006) The American Turkish Society’s mission is to enhance business, economic, diplomatic, and cultural ties between Turkey and the United States. The Society convenes leaders in government, business, and civil society to discuss and advance U.S.-Turkish relations; fosters understanding and cooperation between the two countries through education, cultural exchange, philanthropy, and networking; informs the American public about Turkey’s current affairs, economy, history, and society; presents and supports programs highlighting Turkish arts and culture through its cultural outfit, [http://www.maspny.org/ Moon and Stars Project]; organizes the annual New York Turkish Film Festival; and nurtures the next generation of leaders through its "Young Society Leaders" program.[http://www.turkishjournal.com/i.php?newsid=10971/ Turkish FM, Davutoglu Addresses Inaugural Class of Young Society Leaders] Additionally, The Society has hosted annual gala dinners since 2006 to highlight and celebrate successful economic partnerships between the United States and Turkey and honor extraordinary business leaders who exemplify U.S.-Turkish friendship.[http://www.americanturkishsociety.org/eventfiles/ats_2012_gala_press_coverage.pdf "The American Turkish Society Sixth Annual Gala Dinner"][http://www.americanturkishsociety.org/eventfiles/PRESSCOVERAGE_2011.pdf "The American Turkish Society Gala Dinner 2011 Press Coverage"] Proceeds from the gala dinner support the American Turkish Society's wide-ranging educational and cultural programs.[http://www.americanturkishsociety.org/img/2011_Annual_Report.pdf "The American Turkish Society 2011 Program Report"] The [http://gala.atsociety.org/ 2013 Benefit Gala], held at the [[New York Stock Exchange]], celebrated U.S.-Turkish financial ties and honored U.S. Secretary of Commerce [[Penny Pritzker]] and Turkey Finance Minister [[Mehmet Simsek]].[http://www.marketwatch.com/story/the-american-turkish-society-celebrates-us-turkey-ties-at-nyse-on-november-7th-2013-11-06 "The American Turkish Society Celebrates U.S.-Turkey Ties at NYSE on November 7th"] The [http://www.americanturkishsociety.org/annual-gala/ 2015 Benefit Gala] held at the [[Pierre Hotel]] Ballroom in New York City, celebrated the philanthropic and humanitarian achievements of two honorees: [[Hamdi Ulukaya]], founder and CEO of [[Chobani]] of the USA, and [[Husnu Ozyegin]], founder and CEO of Fiba Holding of Turkey. In early 2016 Mr. Koprulu founded and was elected Chairman of [http://www.americanimmigrantsociety.org/ The American Immigrant Society] with a group of fellow American immigrant citizens. The American Immigrant Society encompasses every country of origin, every ethnicity, every culture and every religion, which is of course the “Melting Pot” that has always defined the nation. The American Immigrant Society believes that America has benefited tremendously throughout its history by welcoming tens of millions of immigrants and refugees from over 95 countries; that the nation is justly proud and lucky to have its extraordinary, hard-working, tenacious immigrant heritage, and must protect and enhance it for a prosperous future. The American Immigrant Society changes the negative narrative, challenges the stereotypes of America's most admired asset throughout the world. The American Immigrant Society seeks also to unite the nation’s major ethnic societies, and facilitate collaboration among leading non-profits committed to improving our celebration of the nation’s immigrant heritage. He is also a long-time supporter/sponsor of [[Children International]] and Children USA, [[Feeding America]], EMPower, SCS Children's Villages, [[Holy Apostles Soup Kitchen]], U.S. Armed Forces – Iraq and Afghanistan Casualty Appeal, [[Salvation Army]] of Manhattan, [[Project Hope]], Project Renewal of New York, [[CARE]], City Harvest of New York, Coalition for the Homeless NYC, [[Goodwill Industries]] of NY/NJ, the Endometriosis Foundation of America, [http://www.citymeals.org/ CityMeals-On-Wheels], New York Cares, and [[UNICEF]]. ==Education and personal life== Köprülü holds a Bachelor of Science in Mathematics and Economics from the University of Maryland, a Master of Science in Economics from the [[London School of Economics]] and an M.Phil in International Trade and Finance from [[Columbia University]]. He is an expert on Middle East geopolitics & conflict, and is a frequent media commentator on emerging market economies, Turkey, and U.S.-Turkey relations. He is proficient in Spanish and fluent in English, Turkish and French. Murat Köprülü has completed five New York City Marathons, two Bosphorus Swim Competitions, three Narragansett Bay Swim Competitions, [and, most recently], the Hunter Mountain Olympic Triathlon in September 2013. He received the Top Fundraiser Award honoring the highest Fundraiser for the New York City Marathon for Team NY Rotary in 2011. He completed the BikeMS biking competition in New York City for the [[National MS Society]] in October 2015, and completed the TCS [[New York City Marathon]] in November 2015, running for the benefit of the New York-based charity,[http://www.citymeals.org/ CityMeals-on-Wheels], and raising the most donor funds as the team runner. He also recently finished the New York City Triathlon in July 2016, competing on behalf of the National Multiple Sclerosis Society [http://www.nationalmssociety.org] and becoming their top fundraiser for the triathlon. [https://results.chronotrack.com/event/results/event/event-22807] Köprülü is a descendant of the [[Köprülü family]], a noble family of the [[Ottoman Empire]]. His father, Ertuğrul Mehmet Köprülü (1921-1983), was a [[Turkey|Turkish]] diplomat to the U.S. and his grand uncle, [[Mehmet Fuat Köprülü]] (1890-1966), was a [[Turkish people|Turkish]] [[politician]] and [[historian]], known for his contributions to [[Ottoman Empire|Ottoman]] history, [[Turkish folklore]], and [[Turkish language]]. ==References== ==External links== * Murat Köprülü executive biography at [http://www.americanturkishsociety.org/aboutus.aspx The American Turkish Society] organizational web site *[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2KQpBkCnGBc/ Video from Bloomberg Habertürk, "Murat Köprülü on the Activities of The American Turkish Society"] *[https://www.bloomberg.com/news/2014-02-04/koprulu-discuses-fundamentals-in-emerging-markets-audio-.html/ Audio Clip from Bloomberg News, "Koprulu Discusses Fundamentals in Emerging Markets"] *[https://www.crowdrise.com/CitymealsNYC2015/fundraiser/muratkoprulu] 2015 Citymeals-on-Wheels NYC Marathon * http://brettonwoods.org/page/september-2015-e-bulletin {{DEFAULTSORT:Koprulu, Murat}} [[Category:American chief executives of financial services companies]] [[Category:American nonprofit businesspeople]] [[Category:Turkish businesspeople]] [[Category:American people of Turkish descent]] [[Category:Businesspeople from New York City]] [[Category:Living people]]

[[Entrepreneur|CFO]] Sandford Loudon |industry = [[Sport]] }} '''MyLocalPitch''' is an [[internet booking engine]] that enables people to book grassroots sports facilities online.{{cite news|url=http://cityam.com/223424/sporty-airbnb-app-gets-ftse-approval-ahead-launch-date|title=Sporty AirBnB app gets FTSE approval|date=2 September 2015|work=CityAM.com }} The company is headquartered in the United Kingdom with offices in Holborn, [[London]]. The service is free to users and is currently available in London, Manchester and Dublin. ==History== MyLocalPitch was founded in January 2014 {{cite news|url=http://startups.co.uk/tech-pitch-mylocalpitch/ |title=Tech Pitch: MyLocalPitch|date=13 June 2017|work=Startups.co.uk }} by Jamie Foale and Sandford Loudon after struggling to find and book sports pitches for their 11-a-side football team.{{cite news|url=http://getwestlondon.co.uk/news/business/friends-set-up-business-make-9256813/|title=Friends set up business to make life easier for amateur sports enthusiasts|date=14 May 2015|work=Getwestlondon.co.uk }} The site started by listing London based sports venues before expanding into [[Dublin]] in March 2015. In November 2015 the MyLocalPitch [[iPhone]] App was released to market{{cite news|url=http://tntmagazine.com/entertainment/mylocalpitch-app-launch/|title=MyLocalPitch launches App|date=2 September 2015|work=TNTMagazine.com }} to enable users to book and search for venues on the move using geolocation.{{cite news|url=http://blog.mylocalpitch.com/mylocalpitch-app-impulsive-sport-at-its-best/|title=Impulsive sports booking|date=20 January 2016|work=MyLocalPitch.com }} MyLocalPitch initiated its 'Outstanding London Sports Venue Award'{{cite news|url=http://islingtongazette.co.uk/news/award_for_market_road_pitches_in_islington_1_4300449|title=Award for Market Road Pitches in Islington|date=6 November 2015|work=Islingtongazette.co.uk }} in 2015 to recognise outstanding sports facilities for services provided and their role in the community. March's award was claimed by Westway Sport and Fitness{{cite news|url=https://londonsport.org/news/westway-sports-and-fitness-march-outstanding-london-sports-venue-award/|title=Award for Westway-Sports-and-Fitness-March-Outstanding-London-Sports-Venue-Award|date=13 April 2016|work=Londonsport.org }} and April's went to Playfootball Romford.{{cite news|url=http://www.romfordrecorder.co.uk/sport/football/playfootball_romford_get_mylocalpitch_outstanding_london_sports_venue_award_1_4531364/|title=PlayFootball-Romford-get-MyLocalPitch-Outstanding-London-Sports-Venue-award|date=11 May 2016|work=Romfordrecorder.co.uk }} In April MyLocalPitch received a 2016 [[Sports Technology Awards]] nomination for the Best Technology to Promote Participation category.{{cite news|url=http://www.sportstechnologyawards.com/shortlist/|title=2016-Sports-Technology-Awards-Shortlist|date=15 April 2016|work=Sportstechnologyawards.com }} As an extension of [[Sport England]]'s new strategy to increase sports participation, MyLocalPitch has introduced bespoke borough pages to further speed up the booking process. A few examples can be seen for Clapham,{{cite news|url=http://www.totallyclapham.co.uk/other-sports/|title=Sports Clubs & Centres in Clapham|date=14 February 2017|work=TotallyClapham }} Islington,{{cite news|url=http://www.islingtongazette.co.uk/news/mylocalpitch_app_aims_to_streamline_process_of_booking_sports_venues_1_4558043|title=MyLocalPitch app aims to streamline process of booking sports venues|date=1 June 2016|work=Islington Gazette }} Hackney{{cite news|url=http://www.hackneygazette.co.uk/news/mylocalpitch_app_aims_to_streamline_process_of_booking_sports_venues_1_4558089|title=MyLocalPitch app aims to streamline process of booking sports venues|date=1 June 2016|work=Hackney Gazette }} and St Albans.{{cite news|url=http://www.hertsad.co.uk/sport/new_website_launched_to_make_accessing_sport_in_st_albans_and_harpenden_easier_1_4715969|title=New website launched to make accessing sport in St Albans and Harpenden easier|date=2 October 2016|work=The Herts Advertiser }} In April 2017 MyLocalPitch launched its second iOS app{{cite news|url=https://www.sportindustry.biz/cutting-edge-sport||title=MyLocalPitch grassroots platform expands north|date=4 April 2017|work=SportIndustry.biz }} with new features including an interactive map, secure payments and a live bookings calendar.{{cite news|url=https://www.siliconrepublic.com/start-ups/mylocalpitch-startup-week|title=Start-up of the week: MyLocalPitch|date=8 May 2017|work=siliconrepublic.com }} The same month saw the MyLocalPitch service became available in Greater Manchester{{cite news|url=https://lovinmanchester.com/news/manchester/theres-a-new-manchester-app-that-lets-you-book-sports-sessions-on-the-go|title=There's A New Manchester App That Lets You Book Sports Sessions On The Go|date=4 May 2016|work=lovinmanchester.com }} with partnerships with Salford Community Leisure{{cite news|url=http://www.salfordcommunityleisure.co.uk/latest-news/mlp|title=MyLocalPitch launches grassroots sports search and booking service for Greater Manchester|date=9 May 2016|work=salfordcommunityleisure.co.uk }} and Greater Sport. In May 2018 MyLocalPitch started working with Brighton Aldridge Community Academy to bring the service to Brighton. As 2017 drew to a close MyLocalPitch signed as London FA's official Bookings Partner{{cite news|url=http://www.londonfa.com/news/2017/dec/mylocalpitch-signs-as-london-fas-official-bookings-partner||title=MyLocalPitch signs as London FA's official Bookings Partner|date=4 December 2017|work=LondonFA.com }} and for the Middlesex FA{{cite news|url=https://www.middlesexfa.com/news/2018/mar/01/mylocalpitch-teams-up-with-middlesex-fa-to-become-its-official-bookings-partner||title=MyLocalPitch signs as Middlesex FA's official Bookings Partner|date=1 March 2018|work=MiddlesexFA.com }} to grow participation numbers. The partnership will provide a simple means for London FA’s members to search and book football facilities in London either online or through the app.{{cite news|url=https://www.sportindustry.biz/news/london-fa-partners-mylocalpitch||title=London FA partners with MyLocalPitch|date=6 December 2017|work=sportindustry.biz }} Daily Mirror features MyLocalPitch's app as number one in its 'Best iPhone apps 2018'.{{cite news|url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/tech/best-ios-apps-2018-iphone-12224827||title=Best iPhone apps 2018|date=22 March 2018|work=Mirror.co.uk }} An Android app launched in August 2018 and has featured in TechWorld{{cite news|url=https://www.techworld.com/startups/mylocalpitch-startup-using-tech-open-up-sports-access-3682599/||title= MyLocalPitch: the startup using tech to open up sports access|date=20 August 2018|work=TechWorld.com }} and AndroidPit{{cite news|url=https://www.androidpit.com/apps-of-the-week-14-10-2018||title= The best 5 new apps worth your time this week|date=14 October 2018|work=AndroidPit.com }}. At the start of 2018 MyLocalPitch became the first London-based SportsTech business to raise more than £1 million{{cite news|url=http://www.businesscloud.co.uk/news/chelseas-graeme-le-saux-joins-mylocalpitch||title=FORMER CHELSEA STAR GRAEME LE SAUX JOINS NEW TEAM|date=23 March 2018|work=businesscloud.co.uk }} and Graeme Le Saux joined the board of directors.{{cite news|url=http://www.bqlive.co.uk/london-the-south/2018/03/22/news/graeme-le-saux-joins-mylocalpitch-following-1m-investment-31340/||title=GRAEME LE SAUX JOINS MYLOCALPITCH FOLLOWING £1M INVESTMENT|date=23 March 2018|work=BQlive.co.uk }} In July, the Football Foundation, the largest sports charity in the UK, has teamed up with MyLocalPitch to roll out its innovative booking portal for community football venues{{cite news|url=http://www.islingtongazette.co.uk/sport/football/football-foundation-teams-up-with-mylocakpitch-1-5635948||title=Football Foundation teams up with MyLocalPitch|date=2 August 2018|work=islingtongazette.co.uk }}. The partnership{{cite news|url=http://www.londonfa.com/news/2018/aug/02/football-foundation-selects-mylocalpitch-to-kick-off-its-digital-community-football-solution||title=FOOTBALL FOUNDATION SELECTS MYLOCALPITCH TO KICK OFF ITS DIGITAL COMMUNITY FOOTBALL SOLUTION|date=2 August 2018|work=LondonFA.com }} seeks to revolutionise the way grassroots players access football facilities by delivering cutting edge technology to venues. ==Popularity== The site has received coverage in the UK media, especially with the Venue Awards which have appeared in London’s Evening Standard,{{cite news|url=http://standard.co.uk/sport/football/arsenal-backed-islington-sports-complex-named-outstanding-london-sports-venue-a3105526.html|title=Market Road ATPs|date=3 November 2015|work=Evening Standard }} Sport and Recreation{{cite news|url=http://www.sportandrecreation.org.uk/news/industry/london-grassroots-sport-booking-platform-crow|title=London grassroots sport booking platform, crowns outstanding sports venue winner|date=5 November 2015|work=Sport and Recreation Alliance }} and London Sport.{{cite news|url=http://londonsport.org/news/west-london-venue-scores-winner-mylocalpitch-award/|title=West London venue scores winner with award|date=14 December 2015|work=LondonSport }} The Irish Sun recently covered the Dublin launch of the instant booking app.{{cite news|url=https://www.thesun.ie/news/978704/new-sports-app-to-make-booking-sports-facilities-for-amateur-sports-players-much-easier/|title= ON THE BALL New sports app to make booking sports facilities for amateur sports players much easier|date=10 May 2017|work=Thesun.ie }} ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *{{official website|https://www.mylocalpitch.com/}} [[Category:Travel websites]] [[Category:Business software]] [[Category:E-commerce]] [[Category:Transport software]] [[Category:Travel technology]] {{travel-website-stub}}

{{Infobox person | name = Nadhmi Auchi | image = | caption = | birth_name = Nadhmi Shakir Auchi | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|df=yes|1937|06|11}} | birth_place = [[Baghdad]], Iraq | death_date = | death_place = | death_cause = | residence = London, England | nationality = British / Iraqi | education = [[Baghdad College|Baghdad College High School]] | alma_mater = [[Al-Mustansiriya University]], Baghdad | occupation = Businessman and Philanthropist | years_active = 1957–present | salary = | title = | spouse = Ibtisam Auchi | children = 4 | networth = US$ 1.5 [[1,000,000,000 (number)|billion]] }} '''Nadhmi Shakir Auchi''', {{post-nominals|country=||post-noms=[[Order of St. Sylvester|KSS]]}}<ref>[http://www.papalknights.org.uk/assoc-members.html Association Members] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120206024623/http://www.papalknights.org.uk/assoc-members.html |date=2012-02-06 }} - official website of the Association of Papal Orders in Great Britain of Pius IX, Saint Gregory and Saint Sylvester</ref> ({{lang-ar|نظمي أوجي}}; born 11 June 1937) is an [[British Iraqis|Iraqi-British]] businessman and billionaire, founding president of the Anglo Arab Organisation,<ref name="AAO">{{cite web |url=http://www.angloarab.org/content.php?title=PRESIDENT |title=Structure & Officers: President |year=2009 |publisher=Anglo Arab Organisation |accessdate=25 July 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111005105049/http://www.angloarab.org/content.php?title=PRESIDENT |archivedate=5 October 2011 |df= }}</ref> and the founder and chairman of [[General Mediterranean Holding]] (GMH), a conglomerate of 120 companies worldwide. As of 2012, his net worth was estimated by [[Forbes]] to be $1.8 billion, making him the 854th richest person in the world.
==Personal life== Born in the Karadat Mariam area of Baghdad, Iraq in 1937 to an [[Chaldean Christians|Chaldean]] family, Auchi attended Al Mansoor Primary School and [[Baghdad College|Baghdad College High School]], before going on to study at Baghdad's [[Mustansiriyah University]]. He married his wife Ibtisam in 1963, and together they have 3 daughters and 1 son, born in 1964 and 1972 respectively. In 1979, he and his family fled to London following an extortion attempt by an enforcer for [[Barzan Ibrahim al-Tikriti]]. Six years later, Auchi's younger brother Naseer was hanged by the Baathist regime after discovering the extent of al-Tikriti's corruption.<ref name="NAF1">{{cite web |url=http://www.nadhmiauchifoundation.org/biography/1937-to-1954 |title=Biographical Timeline |publisher=Nadhmi Auchi Foundation |year=2011 |accessdate=25 July 2011}}</ref> Auchi became a British citizen in 1989 and currently resides in London.<ref name="AAO" /> He and his wife <ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.gmhsa.com/news2009.html |title=News and Events 2009 |year=2009 |publisher=General Mediterranean Holding |accessdate=25 July 2011 |quote=Ibtisam and I share a common desire to foster greater inter-religious relations with the followers of all faiths and we are both well aware and appreciate the important work of the late Pope John Paul II and the current Pope in fostering such work globally |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110820211923/http://www.gmhsa.com/news2009.html |archivedate=20 August 2011 |df= }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.nadhmiauchifoundation.org/2010/07/21/qa-with-nadhmi-auchi |title=Q&A with Nadhmi Auchi |publisher=Nadhmi Auchi Foundation |year=2011 |accessdate=25 July 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110711134338/http://www.nadhmiauchifoundation.org/2010/07/21/qa-with-nadhmi-auchi |archivedate=11 July 2011 |df= }}</ref> have aimed to promote inter-faith dialogue, unity among Arab states, and to build bridges between the West and the Arab world<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.nadhmiauchifoundation.org/good-causes |title=Good Causes |publisher=Nadhmi Auchi Foundation |year=2011 |accessdate=25 July 2011}}</ref> through charitable and humanitarian work, for which Auchi has been recognised.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://investing.businessweek.com/research/stocks/people/person.asp?personId=25967481 |title=Nadhmi Auchi: Executive Profile & Biography |publisher=Bloomberg L.P |year=2011 |work=businessweek.com |accessdate=25 July 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://onthescene.blogs.foxnews.com/2008/06/20/10-iraqis-you-should-know/#Nadhm |title=10 Iraqis You Should Know |first=David |last=MacDougall |author2=Ghalib, Tawfiq |publisher=FOX News Network |date=20 June 2008 |work=foxnews.com |accessdate=25 July 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110726104057/http://onthescene.blogs.foxnews.com/2008/06/20/10-iraqis-you-should-know/#Nadhm |archivedate=26 July 2011 |df= }}</ref>
==Education and career== Auchi graduated with a B.Sc. in Economics and Political Science from [[Al-Mustansiriya University]], Baghdad, in 1967. He also worked with the Iraqi Ministry of Oil, becoming Director of Planning and Development in 1969.<ref name="NAF1" /> In 1979 he founded [[General Mediterranean Holding]] SA in [[Luxembourg]]. He was also Vice-Chair of the [[Kennedy School of Government]] at [[Harvard University]] from 1996 and 2000.
He has been president of the Anglo Arab Organisation (AAO), since its founding in 2002. The AAO is a private non-profit making organisation, promoting the integration of British Arabs into mainstream British society, whilst retaining their identity. AAO's achievements include donating money to families affected by the earthquake in Pakistan in 2005, building a school in the earthquake-devastated town of [[Hoceima]], Morocco and hosting a charity gala that collected £35,000 in donations to the benefit of the Cancer Research Unit of the [[Kingston Hospital]] in London. Auchi and AAO have also led and sponsored high level delegations made up of Arab, British and French dignitaries, religious and political figures pressing for the release of hostages in Baghdad, including securing the release of two French journalists, Christian Chesnot and Georges Malbrunot and their Syrian driver in 2004.
In 2007, Auchi, in collaboration with the [[American University in Cairo]] (AUC) announced the launch of the 'Nadhmi Auchi fellowship for young Arab leaders', a fellowship dedicated to the development of the abilities of Arab youth in institution management and leadership.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.middle-east-online.com/english/?id=22900|title=Auchi launches fellowship for young Arab leaders|work=Middle East Online|year=2007|accessdate=2008-11-15}}</ref> Auchi pays the full study and living costs of ten students from Egypt and other Arab states. The fellowship plan was announced during an annual ceremony at the Egyptian Embassy in London to celebrate AUC achievements.
==Honours and awards== In 1996, the [[President of Tunisia]], [[Zine El Abidine Ben Ali]], made him an Officer of the Order of the Republic. In 2002, he was also awarded the Grand Cordon of the Order of Independence by [[Abdullah II of Jordan|King Abdullah II of Jordan]].
In 2003, Auchi was made a Knight Grand Cross of the [[Royal Order of Francis I]] (GCFO) by [[Prince Carlo, Duke of Castro]], this in recognition of his major contributions to inter-church and inter-faith dialogue. In England, the [[College of Arms]] approved his [[English heraldry|Coat of Arms]] in 2004.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.college-of-arms.gov.uk/Newsletter/001.htm|title=The College of Arms Newsletter|publisher=The College of Arms|year=2004|accessdate=2008-11-15}}</ref> In the same year the president of the [[Republic of Lebanon]], [[Émile Lahoud]], awarded Auchi with the Membership First Grade of the [[Order of Merit (Lebanon)|Lebanese Order of Merit]], having already appointed him as a Commander of the [[National Order of the Cedar]] in 2000. He was made a Knight of the [[Order of St. Sylvester]] (KSS) by Pope [[John Paul II]] in 2004.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.constantinian.com/news-2004.html|title=The Grand Magistral Delegation for Inter Religious Relations|publisher=The Sacred Military Constantinian Order of St George|year=2008|accessdate=2008-11-15|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090122055446/http://constantinian.com/news-2004.html|archivedate=2009-01-22|df=}}</ref>
In 2005 Auchi was made Grao-Mestre da Ordem do Merito Anhanguera in Brazil and was elected as an Honorary Member in the [[International College of Surgeons]] in [[Chicago]], Illinois.
Auchi was awarded 'The Presidential Prize' in 2007 by the President of the American University in Cairo, this in appreciation of his efforts in supporting higher education in the Arab World.
On 18 July 2013, he was awarded the [[Freedom of the City of London]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://democracy.cityoflondon.gov.uk/mgAi.aspx?ID=17687 |title=City of London, Council Meeting Minutes, 18 July 2013 |publisher=Democracy.cityoflondon.gov.uk |date=2013-07-18 |accessdate=2014-07-12}}</ref>
On 13 November 2014, Auchi was appointed a Knight Commander of [[Order of the Nation (Antigua and Barbuda)|the Most Distinguished Order of the Nation]] (KCN) of [[Antigua and Barbuda]].<ref>[http://www.ab.gov.ag/article_details.php?id=5041&category=38 Official Website of the Government of Antigua and Barbuda]</ref> This knighthood was later removed by the Governor General of Antigua following accusations around the circumstances in which it was given.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-3614462/Queen-s-envoy-honours-scandal-Title-given-Commonwealth-chief-s-crony-reviewed-amid-Palace-fury.html|title=Title given to Commonwealth chief's crony 'reviewed' amid Palace fury|access-date=2016-08-28}}</ref>
==Conviction for fraud== In 2003, Auchi was convicted of fraud following his involvement in a $504 million corruption scandal centred on the French oil company [[Elf Aquitaine]], described as "the biggest political and corporate sleaze scandal to hit a western democracy since the second world war".<ref>[https://www.theguardian.com/politics/2003/nov/15/uk.economy "Corruption scandal hits senior politicians"] ''The Guardian'' 23 Nov, 2003.</ref><ref>[https://www.theguardian.com/business/2003/nov/13/france.oilandpetrol "Gigantic sleaze scandal winds up as former Elf oil chiefs are jailed"] ''The Guardian'' 13 Nov, 2003</ref> Auchi was given a $2.8 million fine, along with a 15-month suspended jail sentence, for his involvement in the 1991 purchase by Elf Aquitaine of various Spanish oil refineries and petrol stations, having been accused by prosecutors of funneling $118 million of illegal commissions back to the Elf executives who had initially set up the deal.<ref>[https://www.theguardian.com/world/2003/may/07/france.oil "Oil scandal billionaire tells French court of bribes"] ''The Guardian'' 7 May 2003.</ref>
Following the verdict, Elf (by now merged with TotalFina and renamed Total) decided to take legal action against Auchi in France; Auchi responded by suing Total for $327 million in turn, this time in the UK.<ref>[https://www.independent.co.uk/news/business/news/unwelcome-publicity-for-oil-giant-in-legal-battle-with-billionaire-820750.html "Unwelcome publicity for oil giant in legal battle with billionaire"] ''The Independent'' 4 May 2008.</ref>

[http://www.hwlebsworth.com.au/ HWL Ebsworth Lawyers] |label6 = Size: |data6 = {{convert|1700000|m2|sqft|abbr=on}} |label7 = Developer: |data7 = Douglas Lanceley of Norbrik Brick & Tile co. |label9 = Owner: |data9 = Buildings owned by trust, and investment, open space owned by Council |label10 = Website: |data10 = [http://www.norwestbusinesspark.com.au Norwest Business Park] |label11 = |data11 = }} [[File:Norwest Lake.jpg|thumb|Norwest Lake, Norwest Business Park]] The '''Norwest Business Park''' is a [[business park]] in the suburb of [[Norwest, New South Wales|Norwest]] in [[Local government areas of New South Wales|local government area]] of [[The Hills Shire]] in [[Sydney]], [[New South Wales]], [[Australia]]. Norwest Business Park is bordered by [[Windsor Road (Sydney)|Windsor Road]] to the East, and Old Windsor Road to the West, with Norwest Boulevard stretching the length of the park between the two main arterial roads. It is growing every day with new companies moving in to serve the people of the [[Hills District]]. Over 400 companies are located in the park employing more than 25,000 people. The complex consists of a mix of Commercial, Professional & Health care Services and several office buildings. Australia's largest ice-skating rink, a [[Shopping mall|shopping centre]], [[Novotel]] hotel, two [[Filling station|service stations]], [[Hillsong Church]], [[Virgin Active]] gym, alternative health services, medical centre, commercial law firm [[HWL Ebsworth]], banks, child care centres, drive-through post office, waterways and landscaped public open spaces are all located within the Business Park. Projected employment is 32,000 by 2031. The park is 172 Hectares in area and currently has 800 businesses. Occupied space is currently 500,000m² with Potential for a total of 1.7 million m². ==History== The park was established in 1983, during the Sydney housing boom. Farms had previously occupied the area. The park grew with the expanding population of the area, and the first business to be constructed was the Baulkham Hills Coles supermarket, known as Norwest Markettown. The expansion of the Hillsong Church in the area saw a corresponding expansion in the businesses of the area. In 2005, the [[Woolworths Limited]] head office was constructed, and now employs several thousand staff. Cafes and restaurants also serve the park. Other large scale corporations in the Norwest Business Park include ResMed, [[Australian Associated Motor Insurers Limited|AAMI Insurance]], [[Fitness First]] gym, and one of the [[Reserve Bank of Australia]]'s data centers. [[Subaru]] Australia has an office in Baulkham Hills part of this business area. Norwest also houses Australia's largest law firm (by partner numbers), [[HWL Ebsworth|HWL Ebsworth Lawyers]], being the only national firm with a presence in Greater Western Sydney. The park was conceived & developed by Douglas Boyd Lanceley. ==Transport== The main form of transport to the business park is by bus or by cycling on the off-road Old Windsor Road Cycleway. In late 2005, the [[Westlink M7]] Motorway opened up with an exit at the western end of Norwest Boulevard; this gave the business park greater exposure for businesses in Southern and Western Sydney with motorway exits at the M5 at Prestons and the M4 at Eastern Creek respectively. The [[M2 Hills Motorway]] (which connects with the M7 near Old Windsor Road) also provides travel connections to the Sydney CBD and airport. However the increase of traffic flow from the motorways brought traffic congestion. Norwest Boulevard, Windsor and Old Windsor Roads often suffer traffic jams during morning and afternoon peak times. ===North-West T-Way=== {{Main|North-West T-way}} In late March 2007, the North West T-Way opened, providing relief to the traffic congested business park. The T-Way runs from [[Parramatta]] to Rouse Hill. The T-Way provides frequent bus services between Parramatta and Rouse Hill, promoting the use of public transport in and around Sydney. The route runs primarily along Old Windsor Road with several stops. Three T-way bus stations serve Norwest Business Park; Norbrik (near the corner of Old Windsor Road and Norbrik Drive), Meurants (near the corner of Old Windsor Road and Norwest Boulevard and Celebration (near the corner of Old Windsor Road and Celebration Drive). [[Hillsbus]] Route T64 between Parramatta and Rouse Hill travels through the business park seven days a week. Hillsbus also operate route 618 from the [[Sydney CBD]] via [[Lane Cove]] and route 628 from [[Macquarie Park]] via the M2, Windsor Road through Norwest Boulevard to Lexington Drive. Busways operate Route T70 through Norwest Business Park, linking with Castle Hill and Blacktown. The North West T-Way also runs from Blacktown to Rouse Hill, running along Sunnyholt Road before joining the Parramatta - Rouse Hill T-Way at Burns Road. Until the [[North West Rail Link]] is constructed, the T-Way is the only form of public transport linking the park with Blacktown and Parramatta train stations. The EIS for the construction of two underground railway stations for [http://northwestrail.com.au North West Rail] was released in April 2012 with construction expected to start in 2014. Construction of the rail link commenced in 2014, with two railway stations being built in the Norwest Business Park area - Bella Vista Station and Norwest Station. The North West Rail Link is scheduled to open to the public in the first half of 2019.http://nwrail.transport.nsw.gov.au/The-Project/Project-Overview ==Services== *Norwest Private Hospital *[[Woolworths (supermarket)|Woolworths]] ==References and external links== {{Portal|Sydney|Business}} * [http://www.norwestbusinesspark.com.au Norwest Business Park] * [http://www.sydneyhills.com.au Sydney Hills Business Information] * [http://www.norwestbusinessportal.com.au Norwest Business Portal] {{Coord|33|44|0|S|150|57|49|E|type:landmark|display=title}} ==References== {{Reflist}} [[Category:Business parks]] [[Category:Economy of Sydney]] [[Category:The Hills Shire]]

(Acting) | term_start = June 25, 1979 | term_end = July 21, 1980 | predecessor = [[Patrick John]] | successor = [[Eugenia Charles]] | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1943|8|2}} | birth_place = [[Roseau]], Dominica | death_date = | death_place = | party = [[Dominica Labour Party]] | spouse = | profession = | religion = }} '''Oliver James "O. J." Seraphin''' (or '''Seraphine'''; born August 2, 1943) was the Minister of communication and works and housing for the Labour Party government from 1975- 1979 and [[List of Prime Ministers of Dominica|Prime Minister]] of [[Dominica]] from June 25, 1979, until July 21, 1980. ==Early life== Seraphin grew up in [[Roseau]], the capital, and received primary and secondary education at [[Roseau Mixed School]] and [[Dominica Grammar School]]; later in life, he studied at the [[Carnegie Institute of Technology|Carnegie Institute]] in the [[United States]] and in [[Cuba]]. Prior to politics, he worked in the insurance industry.{{cite web |url=http://www.lennoxhonychurch.com/heritage.cfm?Id=214 |title=Seraphin, Oliver, James "O.J.": |accessdate=2006-11-10 |last=Honychurch |first=Lennox |date= |work=Lennox Honychurch's A-to-Z of Dominica's Heritage}} ==Government Minister== He served in the socialist [[Dominica Labour Party]] government of Prime Minister [[Patrick John]] from 1975 to 1979. Seraphin originally held the posts of Minister of Communications, Works, and Housing, but in a cabinet reshuffle, the Prime Minister made him Minister of Agriculture, Lands, Fisheries and [[Caribbean Community|Caricom]] Affairs. During this time, the Commonwealth of Dominica gained its independence from the [[United Kingdom]]. When violent crowds opposed to the John government protested outside the [[House of Assembly of Dominica|House of Assembly]], Seraphin resigned. [[Image:David 1979 track.png|right|thumb|200px|The path of Hurricane David. Dominica is obscured by an orange dot.]] ==Time as Prime Minister== Seraphin became Prime Minister on June 25 1979, at the request of the "Committee of National Salvation." In August 1979, Dominica was hit by [[Hurricane David]], which killed over 76 people, and devastated much of the island. Seraphin was preoccupied with rescue and rebuilding efforts. He traveled to [[Barbados]], [[Canada]], [[France]], the United States, and [[Venezuela]] to seek financial aid for rebuilding his country's infrastructure, in which he did. He was known to also help and rebuild homes for the homeless financing it all from his own personal account. He restored the island and helped create jobs. In his one (1) plus year in office he is set to have helped over half of the population of the island in the most biggest hurricane disaster the commonwealth of Dominica has ever faced. Although he was loved by many, he lost the 1980 election by [[Eugenia Charles]]. He has not returned to politics. ==Life after politics== Seraphin's government is commonly referred to as the "Interim Government." Since leaving politics, he has returned to business, especially that which is [[tourism]]-related, and maintains a public profile. He is also taking time to spend it with family; His long time wife Lily Seraphin, and his many children. His first child (daughter) Cheryl Seraphin is said to be now living in Paris France; an early retired child Psychologist now pursuing her own high end cake art company in Paris called English Dream Cake. Non of his children entered the world of politics. ==References== {{Reflist}} {{s-start}} {{succession box|title=[[List of Prime Ministers of Dominica|Prime Minister of Dominica]]|before=[[Patrick John]]|after=[[Eugenia Charles]]| years=25 June 1979—21 July 1980}} {{s-end}} {{DominicaPMs}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Seraphin, Oliver}} [[Category:1943 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Roseau]] [[Category:Dominica Labour Party politicians]] [[Category:Prime Ministers of Dominica]] [[Category:Members of the House of Assembly of Dominica]] [[Category:Dominica businesspeople]]
